intro: Acer mono f. rubripes, commonly known as the red-leaf maple, is a cultivar of the species Acer mono, which is native to Japan. It is characterized by its striking red foliage, which becomes more vibrant as the seasons change. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, with a serrated margin and a distinctive red hue during the autumn season. This ornamental tree is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic value and seasonal color display.
